Package de.schildbach.pte.util

Class StringReplaceReader

java.lang.Object
java.io.Reader
java.io.FilterReader
de.schildbach.pte.util.StringReplaceReader
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable, AutoCloseable, Cloneable, Readable
public class StringReplaceReader extends FilterReader implements Cloneable
Given a string pattern, a string replacementPattern and an input stream, this class will replace all occurrences of pattern with replacementPattern in the inputstream. You can give multiple pattern-replacementPattern pairs. Multiple pairs are done in order they are given. If first pair is "cat"-"dog" and second pair is "dog"-"house", then the result will be all occurrences of "cat" or "dog" will be replaced with "house".
Since:
version 0.5, Fixed error that occurred when input was shorter than the pattern

    • contents

      public String contents() throws IOException
      Returns the entire contents of the input stream.

    • replace

      public void replace(String pattern, String replacementPattern) throws OutOfMemoryError
      Adds another pattern-replacementPattern pair. All occurrences of pattern will be replaced with replacementPattern.
      Throws:
      OutOfMemoryError - if there is not enough memory to add new pattern-replacementPattern pair

    • read

      public int read(char[] buffer, int offset, int charsToRead) throws IOException
      Read characters into a portion of an array. This method will block until some input is available, an I/O error occurs, or the end of the stream is reached.
      Overrides:
      read in class FilterReader
      Parameters:
      buffer - Destination buffer
      offset - location in buffer to start storing characters
      charsToRead - maximum characters to read
      Returns:
      number of characters actually read, -1 if reach EOF on reading first character
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs

    • read

      public int read() throws IOException
      Returns the next character in the inputstream with string replacement done.
      Overrides:
      read in class FilterReader
      Throws:

    • eof

      public boolean eof()
      Determines if a previous ASCII I/O operation caught End Of File.
      Returns:
      true if end of file was reached.

    • filterInput

      protected void filterInput() throws IOException
      Read input to see if we have found the pattern. Requires: When this is called we have already have read first character in pattern.
      Side Effects: After attempt to find pattern, output buffer contains either the replacement pattern or all characters we know are not part of pattern.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • fillInputWindow

      protected final void fillInputWindow() throws IOException
      Fill sliding input window with chars from input Read until window is full or reach EOF
      Throws:
      IOException

    • getShift

      protected int getShift(char findMyShift)
      Return the number of positions we can shift pattern when findMyShift is character in inputBuffer after the pattern

    • replacementPatternToBuffer

      protected void replacementPatternToBuffer()
      Put replacement pattern in output buffer. Subclass overrides for more complex replacement
